sections.heading: Before a Fire
items: Install smoke alarms on every level and in sleeping areas; test monthly.
Create and practice a home fire escape plan with two exits from each room.
Keep fire extinguishers accessible and know how to use them (PASS method).
Store flammables safely; don’t overload electrical outlets.
Maintain clear exits and keep space heaters at least 3 feet from anything flammable.

sections.heading: During a Fire
items: Get out, stay out, and call for help. Do not re-enter.
If smoke is present, stay low and crawl under the smoke.
Feel doors for heat before opening; use alternate exits if hot.
Stop, drop, and roll if your clothes catch fire.
Meet at a designated safe location outside.

sections.heading: After a Fire
items: Do not enter your home until authorities say it’s safe.
Beware of structural damage, hot spots, and electrical hazards.
Contact your insurance company and begin documenting losses.
Discard food and water exposed to heat, smoke, or soot.
Seek support for emotional recovery; fires can be traumatic.
